name: Outlying Fishing Isles
role_in_state: seasonal fish and salt supplier; navigational-augury outposts
economy_niches: small craft and repair yards for coastal fleets
seasonal migrant labor housing and ship victualling
culture_adjustments: Island Creole speech layers over Coastal Tongues; nautical argot widespread
looser clan control â€” crew-based affiliations supersede lineage at sea
stronger secrecy around augury rites; local harbor-elders hold practical authority
seasonal mobility normal: dry-season hubs swell, monsoon camps disperse
pragmatic tolerance of illicit trade and informal credit networks
constraints: reliance on imported ritual reagents for major repairs
limited heavy-industry capability (no high-pressure steam tech)
notes: harbor-elders arbitrate under state law but often apply local custom
service to state shipping includes augury fees and pilotage
population flux between isles and mainland shapes governance and trade
